intro: Sericocalyx crispus, commonly known as the rough calyx plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, finely hairy leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Sericocalyx crispus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats.
